Heading is a component for creating typographic headings. ### Variant Variant covers almost all use cases for headings on pages. Their name reflects the places they meant to be used. It takes care of the style of the heading ```js --- type: embed --- For legacy reasons, each variant has a default level set. This is not the recommended way and will be removed in a later major release. Please always specify the level! When variant is set the as prop is ignored A11Y GUIDELINE: There can be only one h1 tag in a page A11Y GUIDELINE: h tags can not skip a level, so for example an h1 followed by an h3 not allowed ``` ```js --- type: example ---
titlePageDesktop
titlePageMobile
titleSection
titleCardSection
titleModule
titleCardLarge
titleCardRegular
titleCardMini
label
labelInline
``` ### AI Heading Pre-configured and with unique styles, the `ai-headings` are used for standardized, ai-related components. ```js --- type: example ---
Nutrition Facts Nutrition Facts Nutrition Facts
``` ### Heading level What DOM element is output is determined in the following order: 1. (deprecated) If the variant prop is set, then the value of level prop. If variant is set but level is not,

-

based on the variant prop's value. 2. The value of the `as` prop 3. The value of the `level` prop 4. `

` The `variant` and `level` props sets its appearance in this order. ```js --- type: example ---
This renders as <h3>
``` ### Heading colors The default color is `primary`, but it can be set to `secondary`, `primary-on`, `secondary-on` or `inherit` via the `color` prop. Note there is an inverse option available as well: `primary-inverse` or `secondary-inverse` (_see inverse example below_). ```js --- type: example ---
I inherit my color via the CSS cascade
I am primary color (default) I am secondary color I am primary-inverse color I am secondary-inverse color I am primary-on color I am secondary-on color
``` ### Icons With the `renderIcon` prop, an icon can be rendered before the text. ```js --- type: example ---
}>I am heading with icon
``` ### Heading borders The default is no borders. However, using the `border` prop, you can add either `top` or `bottom` borders to your heading. ```js --- type: example ---
I have a bottom border I have a top border
``` ### Ellipsis text overflow Use [TruncateText](TruncateText) if you need to constrain your Heading to a single line (or certain number of lines). ```js --- type: example --- {lorem.paragraph()} ``` ### Guidelines ```js --- type: embed --- ```
